neighbors.name: George Shamblin
neighbors.claims: George Shamblin is listed at 23 Drake Street in Oakfield (Genesee County) and owned parcel 12.-1-58 as of 2013, indicating a longtime local residency [Locate Family](https://www.locatefamily.com/S/SHA/SHAMBLIN-48.html). No records of Shamblin holding any public office or speaking in local meetings were found in news or municipal archives as of this report (i.e., he has not been mentioned in Oakfield community news searches).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use personal, respectful outreach through family or longtime community contacts to understand any concerns, given his status as an elderly long-term resident.

neighbors.name: Anne Bezon
neighbors.claims: Anne M. Bezon is a Genesee County social worker (Oakfield-Alabama Central School alumna) who was hired in 2012 as supervisor of the Justice for Children Advocacy Center under the Sheriff’s Office [The Batavian](https://www.thebatavian.com/howard-owens/anne-bezon-named-supervisor-child-advocacy-center/33598). She has been active in community leadership, including completing the Leadership Genesee program, but has no public record of commenting on development or energy projects [The Batavian](https://www.thebatavian.com/howard-owens/anne-bezon-named-supervisor-child-advocacy-center/33598).

approach_recommendations.engage: Highlight local benefits to community services and youth programs when engaging her, leveraging her civic-minded background and emphasizing how development revenues (e.g., taxes or grants) could support social initiatives.

neighbors.name: Brian Pritchett
neighbors.claims: A 2015 public salary record indicates Brian Pritchett was employed as a New York State Police trooper, suggesting he is a career law enforcement officer in the region [GovSalaries](https://govsalaries.com/pritchett-brian-c-39879290). There is no evidence of Pritchett serving in any local government capacity or making public statements on development issues in Genesee County (his name does not appear in local news or town meeting records related to such projects).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a safety-focused dialogue, possibly involving a law enforcement liaison, to address any traffic or public safety concerns he may have, given his professional background.

overview_summary: None of the three profiled neighbors have a documented public stance on local development, with all categorized as "unknown" in the absence of any stated support or opposition. In terms of community influence, none hold elected office or major public roles; one neighbor (Bezon) has a moderate profile due to her county advocacy position, while the other two appear to wield low influence as private residents.
